page.title: 15Survey-Comprehensive style
page.content: The area of Trowbridge we at John of Gaunt surveyed lies to the west of the town and is bordered by Frome Road, Newtown, the railway line on one side and the urban distric boundary on the other. This area was broken into six sections and each was surveyed by a team of pupils. This report is a summary of all their surveys. This area is one of great contrasts in nearly every respect. It is mainly built up and residential but there is a variety of commercial, educational and religious establishments. There is also quite a lot of open land that is used for a variety of purposes. The housing in the area is extremely varied. It is substantially private housing although the Studley Green Estate is a council scheme.
